intro: Barrosoa metensis, commonly known as the Metenese barrosoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. The leaves are broad and palmate, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical gardens.
